result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerica L Cotton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 469 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution for Acuity Insurance to be paid Joint and Several as a condition of Extended Supervision. Restitution to be paid before costs and fees. Restitution to be reviewed at future hearing.
08/25/2016 RESTITUTION AMENDED AT HEARING. ACUITY CLAIM #NX0431 $17,318.52 AND CLAIM #NT7676 $20,000.00. ALL RESTITUTION TO BE PAID JOINT AND SEVERAL.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

No Contact with victim's family or with co-defendants. Provide DNA specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Motion for Sentence Modification, with attached exhibits 1 - 5;  filed by the Defendant; Pursuant to the Supreme Courts Order issued 04-13-2020, this document is deemed filed 11-06-2020 because that is the date it was mailed.  
  **Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 11-11-2020:  request denied. Being declared eligable, does not mean it has to happen, and although some of those programs might allow for early release, the sentence was contemplating straight time, no early release, so there is nothing new to consider.**

Motion for Sentence Modification;  filed by the Defendant; Pursuant to the Supreme Courts Order issued 04-13-2020, this document is deemed filed 08-26-2020 because that is the date it was mailed.  
  **Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 09-02-2020:  Denied, COVID is not a valid reason for changing sentencing.**

Exhibit #1 from restitution hearing held on 8/25/16 - destroyed pursuant to statute
from Restitution hearing held on 7/28/16
from Restitution hearing held on 8/25/16
Exhibit #1 from restitution hearing held on 8/25/16

This case is called along with Case #15CF70 (State vs. Darrin Malone).  Defendant Jerica L Cotton appears by videoconference from Taycheedah.  Attorney J Anthony Rosario appears on behalf of Defendant.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties do not contest restitution amount to Whiterock LLC paid by Acuity.  2nd amount paid by Acuity ($18,718.52) is contested.  Case proceeds to testimony.  Jodi E. is sworn-in and testifies.  State's exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received. Cross-examination by Attorney Rosario.  Cross-examination by Attorney Bihler.  No further testimony.  Testimony is closed.  State gives closing statements.  Closing statements made by Attorney Rosario.  Closing statements made by Attorney Bihler.  Court finds that part of item #2 is not reasonable but does not know the breakdown of charges on that item.  Court finds that all other amounts are reasonable and allows/orders payment of such restitution by both parties.  Attorney Bihler raises issue of Mr. Malone's ability to pay.  Attorney Rosario also raises issues with ability to pay for Ms. Cotton.   Court orders restitution in amounts ordered by both parties, joint and several.  State requests that parties be ordered to pay a portion of item #2 so that a final amount can be determined today.  Both parties' attorney agree to have item #2 split in half.  Court orders restitution on item #2 in the amount of $1,400.00, for a TOTAL of $17,318.52 to Acuity on claim #NX0431 and $20,000.00 to Acuity on claim #NT7676 - all ordered joint and several.

Current: 751 County Road K, Taycheedah Correctional, Fond du Lac, WI 54936 United States  (Effective: 07-29-2016)
Prior: 515 West Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Restitution hearing on August 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Case called for restitution hearing along with Case #15CF70 (State vs. Darrin Malone).  Defendant Darrin L Malone appears by videoconference from Dodge Correctional, in custody.  Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler appears on behalf of Darrin Malone.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Anthony Rosario appears on behalf of Jerica Cotton who appears by telephone from Taycheedah.  State recites restitution amounts.  Attorney Rosario states that Ms. Cotton does not contest restitution amounts recited by the state.  Attorney Bihler states that Mr. Malone does contest some amounts as well as Mr. Malone's ability to pay due to his lengthy incarceration.  State makes additional comments.  Attorney Bihler makes additional statements.  Attorney Rosario makes statements.  Court adjourns so that further proof can be obtained (regarding damage was done due to incident).  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Restitution hearing on July 28, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney J Anthony Rosario in court.   Defendant Jerica L Cotton did not appear.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case not called on the record.  Attorney Rosario and attorney for Co-Defendant both request an adjournment.  Court adjourns.  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Dated 06/28/16, from the Defendant to Judge Carter, requesting amendment of JOC. CC to DA and Atty Rosario.  Sent to Judge Carter for review.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 04/28/16 sentencing hearing.
Dated 05/05/16, from the State to Acuity Insurance, regarding restitution.
Restitution hearing on July 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Personal Education Plan for Defendant filed by Attorney Rosario

Defendant Jerica L Cotton in court, in custody, with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Susan L. Opper and Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  Case proceeds to sentencing.  Court and parties go through errors/modifications contained in presentence investigation.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Rosario makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

18 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 469 days)
  -   8 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  - 10 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: victims family or with Co-Defendant's
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $18,718.52 to Acuity (Joint and Several)  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision -restitution to be paid before costs or fines) 

COSTS:  $278.0 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Filed

Defendant Jerica L Cotton in court, in custody, with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Attorney Rosario makes some statements regarding sentencing.  Court orders presentence investigation.  Court adjourns sentencing.  Bail is revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
